issues.title: Dbus objects?
issues.body:
The wiki looks pretty out of date for the dbus options. I saw somewhere that a while ago you could use dbus to control pandora. I am looking to do this so that I can control pithos with custom key bindings using my i3 config. 

The command I found was:
```
dbus-send --print-reply --dest=net.kevinmehall.Pithos /net/kevinmehall/Pithos net.kevinmehall.Pithos.SkipSong
```

I modified the command to use the new dbus service name `io.github.Pithos` but am getting this error:
```bash
$ dbus-send --print-reply --dest=io.github.Pithos /io/github/Pithos io.github.Pithos.PlayPause
Error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.UnknownMethod: No such interface 'io.github.Pithos' on object at path /io/github/Pithos
```

What would be the new command for this? Is the dbus still supported outside of mpris?

issues.title: Password forgotten after logging out/in or reboot
issues.body:
Pithos will remember my password until the system reboots, after which I need to sign in again.  Interestingly, it always remembers my email address.

How can I troubleshoot this? Not sure what other information to provide.

Pithos version: 1.3.1
System: Gentoo
DE/WM: KDE/Kwin

issues.title: HeaderBar
issues.body:
In the course of the ongoing redesigning of Pithos the decision was made to more closely follow the Gnome Shell HIG. While in many ways this is a good thing, one feature of the Gnome Shell HIG, the HeaderBar, will cause Pithos to look out of place on any Desktop Environment other that Gnome.

In an effort to ensure that Pithos does not lose favor with non-Gnome users I took it upon myself to find a way for the HeaderBar to be used without the unfortunate side effects. I believe I have done so.

I have written a wrapper around HeaderBar, with an almost one to one API, that will allow for HeaderBar to be enabled/disabled with one function call and no duplicated code. I have released this wrapper under GPL 2 and request that the Pithos community look into using either it or the ideas it is built upon.

Wrapperbar: https://github.com/ForLoveOfCats/wrapperbar

issues.title: Keyring issue with KDE on Wayland
issues.body:
I'm starting the move to KDE on Wayland, but Pithos isn't running because of a keyring issue. I have the keyring unlocked (SDDM unlocks libsecret "login" on login), and it works just fine in X. Here's the Error Dialog Text:

**Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached**
    You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring

And here's the log running from the command line:
```
ERROR - util:on_get_finish:88 - Failed to get Secret.Service, Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
ERROR - pithos:on_keyring_unlocked:280 - You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring. Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
```
I'd really appreciate a fix for this, since I'd like to use Plasma on Wayland as much as I can.

issues.title: Missing Volume Icon
issues.body: I'm using latest Git from the AUR. The volume icon is a question mark. I'm on Manjaro KDE. Is this just an issue trying to access the wrong resource via GTK, or something on my end?

issues.title: Hide Statusbar
issues.body:
Alright, so I did a quick search through issues, and found #81. It didn't have much about the statusbar, and I didn't read through the whole thing, but I didn't get much on this.

Basically I'm wondering what would be required to hide the statusbar when it's not in use. For example, when pithos is "Getting Songs", the statusbar would be shown, but just about any other time it's empty and eating up space. I'm not familiar with Gtk, or its documentation. What would be required to do this?

issues.title: Play Next in song context menu
issues.body: Sometimes I want to not play a song in a playlist without necessarily giving it a negative rating or sleeping it. Maybe I just like a song after it in the playlist better and would rather hear it next? I'm not suggesting that we should be able to play a playlist out of order or have a proper play queue, not that there would even be a point to that with only at most 5 songs to pick from. I just think it would be nice to just be able to click an upcoming song in a playlist and say play this one next.

issues.title: Window sizing edge case with Wayland on GNOME after unmaximizing
issues.body:
If you maximize Pithos and then "hide" it to a MPRIS widget(or also I assume the notification icon?) and then show it again and unmaximize it the window goes to it's minimum size.
![screenshot from 2017-11-25 08-40-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6667703/33231546-66685528-d1bc-11e7-9e0b-a6c087e916a5.png)

In X the window situation is pretty much the opposite. The widow will end up filling about 3/4 of my screen after unmaximizing. That's not great either but it's better than what happens in Wayland.

I've tried various hacks but I can't find anything that works very well. Of the 2 I like the X behavior better. It would be nice if the X and Wayland experiences were a little more consistent.

I will search to see if I can find an upstream bug report related to this or @TingPing if you know anyone in the know upstream maybe you could mention this to them.

I really think that this is something that should be addressed upstream in GNOME.

issues.title: Move the Player logic out of the main class
Switch to pure GObject for networking
issues.body:
We've talked about this a little in the past @TingPing but I've recently been playing around with Soup and have had some success with doing some Pure GObject networking. It's a baby step but checkout this Gist:

https://gist.github.com/JasonLG1979/a0691d08c02f20358dc27b5ecddf9270

It takes a http request header, data, proxy and all and returns the response bytes. I scabbed it into Pandora.py and it returns the same thing as the pure python code. So at some point in the near future I'd like to replace all of our network code with async GObject stuff. That would remove the need for GObjectWorker. The only real sticking point I think is pylast. But really as little of it that we use I could probably write a small "Glast" module?

issues.title: New Plugin Idea: 10 band Eq.
issues.body: Since a 10 band eq plugin is built into Gstreamer plugins-good https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/data/doc/gstreamer/head/gst-plugins-good-plugins/html/gst-plugins-good-plugins-equalizer-10bands.html the hardest part would be the UI(still not that hard ;P) my thought is to have a few basic presets and allow the user to save their own custom presets, pretty much like every other Eq in any other player. It also opens it up to a potentially interesting feature. We could have an option to link a station to a Eq preset. So for example your hip hop station and classic country stations could have their own presets and they would change automatically as you changed to those stations.

issues.title: UX Papercuts
issues.body:
The purpose of this issue is to establish the existence of , discuss and track small relatively easily fixed user experience bugs. 

A couple guidelines:

1. This is not a place to request new features. We want to polish what we have here.

2. We will do our best to follow the GNOME HIG/design patterns but at the same time also do our best not to ruin the user experience in other Desktop Environments.

issues.title: Packagers Wanted
issues.body:
We currently need packagers. If you want an up to date version of Pithos for your distro of choice then roll up your sleeves and get involved. Become a Pithos packager.

Pithos requires at least Gtk 3.18 + GLib 2.46.

So far the following Distros are covered:
Ubuntu (16.04 - 17.04)
Arch
Fedora

issues.title: Playlist support is broken in the Ubuntu sound menu
issues.body:
Just a reference to the upstream bug. I'm sure once the new release hit users will wonder why playlists don't work in Ubuntu's sound menu...

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/indicator-sound/+bug/1663906

issues.title: Genre stations
Prefs design
issues.body:
After playing around with rewriting our notifications and adding options to the notify plugin it seems to me that the plugins section of the prefs ui could use a little tweaking. I propose something like this:
![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/18611541/025a64d2-7d02-11e6-861d-672df70a8de1.gif)
1. Ditch the common plugin prefs button and put a prefs button for the plugin in the plugin's box(if it has prefs ofc)
2. Pick a unified style/size for plugin prefs dialogs.
3. do the stuff I talked about in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/344

commits.message:
Bind XF86AudioPause to userpause in keybinder

Can't forget about keybinder...
Simplify mediakeys plugin logic a bit.
Workaround MATE not updating it's window state properly
Listen for 'Pause' mediakeys action

Fix up win-pos code a bit.

1. Don't bother reading or setting the window position in Wayland.
2. self.settings['win-pos'] can never be (None, None) but self.get_position() can be.
3. Block the configure event handler when we move the window.
Fix typo in GNOME mediakeys service name

Use Gtk.ComboBoxText for the audio quality combo and define the list in the UI file.

This removes the need for all creation logic in PreferencesPithosDialog.py and negates the need for valid_audio_formats in data.py

Default to highQuality

As discussed in and fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/538

Only apply GNOME shell notification bug workaround to GNOME

The bug has been reported upstream with a test case/app. See: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=790636

Work Around Broken Notification Servers (#541)

Deepin's notification system is broken, see: https://github.com/gnumdk/lollypop/issues/1203
This will stop exceptions by ignoring parameters and send a warning message about the broken signal.

This also fixes a workaround for GNOME sending multiple redundant 'NotificationClosed' signals.

The original workaround breaks actions in KNotifications because KNotifications does not increment the notification id's as they should. Instead each app has it's own id. Including signal_value in self._last_signal make it work for both.

And covers about anything else that can go wrong in do_g_signal as gracefully as possible.

Make Pandora error string more clear.

as discussed in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/535

Fix line continuation in the Pandora error strings

I noticed imcomplete error messages while debugging https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/534
Remove unneeded icons prop from volume button
No need to use the worker for functions that do not do blocking I/O

Fix logging.root.handlers getting reset and KeyError when using -last-logs command line arg

fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/518

Fix TypeError in DBusServiceObject.py

fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/516

We can't use the GstAudio constants

As much as I would prefer to use the GstAudio.AUDIO_RESAMPLER_QUALITY_MAX and GstAudio.AudioResamplerFilterMode.FULL constants, they don't exist in the version of Gstreamer that ships with *buntu 16.04. Trying to use them in *buntu 16.04 crashes Pithos.

Instead just set "quality" and "sinc-filter-mode" to the values the constants would be if they existed...
We create and delete stations but don't append or remove them from pandora.stations as we should. this fixes that.
Ensure that the notification icon and journald logging plugin prefs windows are not destroyed when they recieve a delete event
Handle socket errors in pandora.py

song.title should not be a property

If song.title is a decorated property with a getter that means that the 1st thing to access it has to potentially do a blocking network call. It just so happens that the 1st thing to access song.title does so from the main thread. Doing blocking calls from the main thread is ofc bad. This instead moves checking the title to init to make sure that any blocking calls are done from a worker thread.

Eq fixup

Save a default state(eq flat) if there is no plugin['data'] value yet. Fixes an exception at the 1st run of the plugin.
Sort Plugins Alphabetically
Fix Typo in auto_volume_normalization.py

Use trackGain from Pandora to fake a ReplayGain Plugin

Use the ReplayGain Gstreamer Elements in conjunction with the trackGain from Pandora to create a "Auto Volume Normalization" plugin.

pull_requests.title: Move player logic out of main
pull_requests.body: Still a wip at the moment but I wanted to put in the PR so we could polish it up. currently this PR creates a custom player pipeline and abstracts as much out as possible as far as I can tell. It removes pretty much all gstreamer code from pithos.py. The proxy support and auto plugin install still needs tested.

issues.title: Add a replay feature
issues.body: The official Pandora client on Android now has a feature where you can select and play previously played songs. I'm not sure the implementation details since playlists do expire so we should look into if there is an API to request a single song again.

issues.title: notification_icon: Add option to toggle using AppIndicator
issues.body: There are situations where AppIndicator is worse than GtkStatusIcon for example with legacy trays it doesn't support scrolling. A simple option would be nice.

issues.title: Improve acessibility
issues.body:
This is just a tracking issue making sure everything is tested. We need to ensure the entire application is navigable without sight or mouse input.

Some of this was done in 58b01fcb770edefd70ee5ec400676c4b8c4faa23 but this needs to happen for every window. Keyboard shortcuts are currently broken too because we override space and enter for everything in the main window.

@JasonLG1979 Opinion?

Ok so making the assumption you are on a checkout of your fork.

```
git remote add upstream https://github.com/pithos/pithos.git
git fetch upstream
git checkout upstream/wip/headerbar
```

![pithos gnome](https://i.imgur.com/FTsvY7X.png)
Consider that icon just a test :P

If the icon was changed back to the current layout of a station name drop down it is just far too wide. It is possible to do some fancy things where clicking on the title turns into the drop down, but I feel that is a hidden feature while space efficient.
See epiphany for an example of what i mean, or I can do a mock up.

review_comments.body: Why are you linking to your own site and what did the old image used to be?
Should be `self.statusicon = Gtk.StatusIcon.new_from_file(get_data_file('media', 'icon.png'))`
Print a warning that it was not found with the logger.
Also move the import to the top of both files.
Remove this, just don't hook scrolling below.
Quite the odd function name... raise with a down arguement?
Remove this whitespace
Based on #159 you already know this is invalid.

Except it does use python3 by default and you had to call it with python2 manually... https://github.com/pithos/pithos/blob/master/setup.py#L1

Also setuptools is absolutely useless for checking for deps and since they are runtime deps it would be counter productive for packagers to force deps anyway.

> The app itself should check for missing libs at runtime

Well uh, yea it does, you get that for free. Optional plugins handle it nicely and pithos refuses to start basically, as expected.
No reason for this change.
This likely should not compare against None. If it succeeds it will always return > 0 and if it fails it returns 0, in which case you _want_ a new timeout.
Same note here about None.
This call is unnecessary. Once `update_song_row` returns False (aka paused) it will already destroy it.
Minor style thing: `percent = self._query_buffer.parse_buffering_percent()[1]`
Maybe make use of `player_status` or similar instead of adding new variables?
Maybe something like `on_buffer_timer` makes more sense as a name?

issues.title: Station Drop menu doesn't work - Ubuntu 17.10 (on Wayland)
issues.body: Have Ubuntu 17.10, and after installing Pithos from it's PPA, I find I am unable to change the station, clicking on the station drop down menu, does nothing. Everything else thus far seems to work though. On the default Wayland session.

issues.title: Frequent skips during playback
issues.body: I've started to notice frequent skips in audio during playback, running Pithos 1.4.0 on Ubuntu 17.10.  They're short, maybe a quarter of a second, and seem to occur randomly, maybe once a minute or so.  I'm not sure where to even begin in terms of debugging this issue.  Has anyone seen any similar behaviour?  Is this likely a buffering issue?  I can't imagine it's a network connection problem.  I don't notice any CPU spikes or anything when this happens, either.  Suggestions welcome.

issues.title: Pandora Premium version of Pithos?
issues.body: Hi - wondering if you have plans on making a "Pandora Premium" version of Pithos?  Pandora Premium gives the ability for folks to search for music or play albums created manually.

Robert

issues.title: Support Pandora Plus and it's new replay song feature.
issues.body: Pandora One has changed to Pandora Plus which includes a feature that allows you to replay a song as much as you want. Is this support planned for Pithos?

issues.title: Pithos stops playing at beginning of random song Raspberry Pi
issues.body:
Hello there. I am still having this issue. Here are some details:
- Pithos v1.2.1
- Raspberry Pi 2
- Ubuntu Mate 16.04
- Wired ethernet connection and I have tried WiFi connection. Both connections 50+ mbps lines.
- Pandora account not One subscription.
- Running Pithos from terminal and no warnings thrown in standard output.
- Desktop running with no screensaver, no sleep, etc. Always up and running.
- Pithos no plugins installed. No proxy. Explicit music allowed.

Same issue as this issue was initially having issues with. Pithos will play great for 20 - 60 minutes then randomly it will get to a song and not play. No issues stopping halfway into a song, but not playing the next song in station.

More details located [on other issue](https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/94) starting at [this comment](https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/94#issuecomment-243298951)

issues.title: Notification tray plugin doesn't remember window position when hiding / showing
issues.body:
I noticed that when I click the pithos icon (Mate 1.12) the window always pops up in the upper left corner, regardless of where it was before hiding it. To make things consistent, I would recommend the notification plugin remembering the window position when hidden, and setting that when showing the pithos app. 

I was able to reproduce this in Ubuntu and ArchLinux.
Pithos 1.2.1 (both distros); Arch GTK3.20, Ubuntu GTK3.18.

issue_comments.body:
Sorry, I don't know anything about packaging for Fedora (or Debian/Ubuntu for that matter). All I did was get the python setup working using setuptools instead of distribute and then make a few tweaks to the existing setup for debian packages to keep them working.
You should at least be able to install from source, even if there are no rpm packages.
@TingPing You still need to update the dependencies. For debian, that meant switching from python-distutils-extra (>= 2.10) to python-setuptools (>= 0.6.10)
Ahh, got it.

It already is configurable in Pithos. All I did was add dbus watches for the screen saver objects for Cinnamon and KDE to where Pithos was already setting a watch on the Gnome screen saver object. The option is still toggled the same way as before.
I can squash the commits later if you want.

as the first line of `on_enable()`
Sorry, I missed that `loaded` is assigned in the else clause. It's fine as is.
